baseline_groups.claim_summary: Average treatment effect of Common Value (CV) vs Common Probability (CP) auction format on bid factors (naive/break-even/Nash benchmarks) in Experiment I lab auction with 4 bidders. OLS and median regression, clustered at subject level.
baseline_groups.notes: Six baseline specs covering 3 outcome measures (BF, BEBF, NEBF) x 2 estimators (OLS, median regression). Reduced sample: exp==1, rrange==1, domnBid<=8. All baselines highly significant. Primary baseline is BF-OLS (run_001).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Average treatment effect of CV vs CP lottery type on price factors in individual decision-making (no strategic interaction), Experiment II stage 22. OLS and median regression, clustered at subject level.
baseline_groups.notes: Two baseline specs: OLS (run_033, p=0.002) and median regression (run_034, p<0.001). Experiment II stage 22 (compound lottery with signal). Primary baseline is OLS.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Decision weights in bidding: coefficient on log-fixed component (lnfix) in log-bid structural regressions, testing how subjects weight probability vs value uncertainty. Median regression with subject-clustered SEs, Experiment I.
baseline_groups.notes: Three baseline specs from Table A4: CV decision weights (run_044), CP decision weights (run_045), and interaction model (run_046). The key claim is that lnfix coefficient is positive (subjects respond to the fixed/value component). Different sample restrictions yield different N (CV-only: 3253, CP-only: 2564, pooled: 5817).

global_notes: No changes to baseline group assignments relative to the surface. Notable issues: (1) spec_ids are not unique within the paper -- the same spec_id (e.g., rc/sample/full_sample) is applied across multiple outcomes and estimators, differentiated only by spec_run_id. This is flagged but not invalid given the lab experiment structure where each sample variant is crossed with multiple outcomes/estimators. (2) Some design/diff_in_means rows (runs 025-030, 040-041) are applied to non-baseline samples (full_sample, winners_only, stage21, stage1) but retain the design spec_id rather than a compound id. (3) G2 stage1 subsample (runs 038-039) produces negative coefficients, opposite to the baseline sign.
